page.title: 08ASHDOWN FOREST LIFE AND WORK
page.content: Very few people live or work here. The two private estates of Old Lodge and Pippingford Park each consist of a large house with farmland and cottages for workers. Much of Pippingford is used by the Ministry of Defence. There are some smaller farms and small- holdings. Though isolated, the people seemed content. The land is only fit for grazing or perhaps producing wood for fencing etc. The radio masts, visible for miles around, belong to the former Diplomatic Corps Radio Station, important in the Second World War and later in transmitting the BBC World Service. The Station is no longer in use, its staff reduced to lO, and the only living creatures to be seen are Highland cattle which graze the enclosed area and are looked after by the wife of one of the Rangers.
